title: Support shared first place on tied winning scores

requirements.summary: Update scoring result types and utilities to return all tied winners when a win condition is met.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/lib/scoring.ts` no longer limits game-end results to a single winner when a tie occurs.
When the winning condition is met and multiple players share the winning score, the game-end result includes all tied players (not just the first one).
No TypeScript errors in callers due to the updated result type.

file_operations.description: Refactor the game-end result model from a single optional winner to a plural winners collection (supporting ties), and update checkGameEnd to compute the winning score then include all players tied at that score when the game-end condition is satisfied (e.g., for Nerts and Flip7). Ensure the exported types and return shapes remain consistent so downstream callers can be updated without TypeScript errors.

requirements.summary: Update the ScoreSheet game-over banner to display either a single winner or a tie for first with all tied names and the winning score.
acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/screens/ScoreSheetScreen.tsx`, when the game is ended and multiple winners exist, the UI renders messaging that indicates a tie for first place (in English).
When exactly one winner exists, the UI continues to show the existing single-winner message.
The standings list remains unchanged and continues to render all players and totals.

file_operations.description: Update the game-over UI logic to consume the new plural winners result from checkGameEnd. When winners.length > 1, render English tie-for-first messaging that lists all tied player names and shows the shared winning score; when winners.length === 1, keep the existing single-winner phrasing. Do not change the standings rendering.
